newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Primax gains T$200M from subsidiary listing.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Primax gains T$200M from subsidiary listing.

text.p: Taiwan's Primax Electronics said on Wednesday it gained about T$200 million in non-operating profits by listing U.S. subsidiary Storm Primax in the U.S. over-the-counter market.
Storm Primax became listed on Tuesday on the Nasdaq, offering 2.75 million shares. The parent released 772,500 of its existing shares. The rest were released through rights issues.
"The listing of Storm Primax will give us about T$200 million in non-operating profits," a Primax executive said by telephone.
Primax Electronics may raise its profit target for 1996, but has not made a final decision, the executive said.
Spurred by news of the subsidiary's Nasdaq debut, Primax had gained 4.27 percent or T$2.50 to T$61 after 85 minutes of trading in Taiwan's stock market on Wednesday.
"Investors are very optimistic about Primax's future after the listing of Storm Primax," said Michael Hung of Nikko Securities.
